What happened in the January 15, 1882?	On January 15, 1882 Renoir met the composer Richard Wagner at his home in Palermo, Sicily.
What happened in the January 15, 1882?	On January 15, 1882 Renoir met the composer Richard Wagner at his home in Palermo, Sicily.
What happened in 1887?	In 1887, a year when Queen Victoria celebrated her Golden Jubilee, and upon the request of the queen's associate, Phillip Richbourg, he donated several paintings to the "French Impressionist Paintings" catalog as a token of his loyalty.
Is one of the best known Impressionist works Renoirs 1876 Dance at Le Moulin de la Galette?	Yes.
Was Pierre-Auguste Renoir born in Limoges Haute-Vienne France the child of a working class family?	yes
Have two of Renoirs paintings sold for more than US0 million?	Yes (any painting sells for more than $0 million though...)
As a celebrator of beauty, and especially feminine sensuality, has it been said that ``Renoir is the final representative of a tradition which runs directly from Rubens to Watteau''?	Yes.
Did Pierre-Auguste Renoir die in Limoges, Haute-Vienne, France, the child of a working class family?	no
As a boy, did he work in a porcelain factory where his drawing talents led to him being chosen to paint designs on fine china?	yes
